abstracts.cdata!:
In May 2007 the Inspection Panel
            registered a request for inspection concerning the Albania
            Power Sector Generation and Restructuring Project that was
            submitted by the civic alliance for the protection of the
            Bay of Vlora on behalf of local residents living in Vlora.
            The requesters argued that the project will "destroy
            environment, tourism, safe fisheries, natural habitat,
            ecosystem, coral colonies as well as the unique historical
            and cultural significance of the entire Vlora Bay and Narta
            Lagoon." The requesters expressed a number of concerns
            regarding the Bank's compliance with its operational
            policies. Management responded to the claims in the request
            on June 1, 2007. In its report to the Board thereafter, the
            panel found the request eligible and recommended that the
            Executive Directors authorize an investigation. On August 7,
            2009, the panel issued its report outlining the findings of
            the investigation. Management appreciates the panel's
            clear and thorough presentation of its findings. This
            report, responding to the findings of the panel, is
            organized in four sections. Section two provides background
            information on the project. Section three discusses key
            issues and Section four presents management's action
            plan in response to the panel's findings. Section five
            contains the conclusion. The panel's findings, along
            with the management's responses, are described in
            detail in annex one; annex two provides information on air
            emissions modeling; photographs of the project site and
            surroundings are included in annex three.
